name: Holiday Inn London Kensington Forum

reviews.text: Located close to Gloucester Road underground station, this hotel offers a nice place to stay in a really good situation. Rooms are ok, toilette is tiny (as usual in London). Free WIFI should be and standard in 4* hotels, but you won't find it even in the main lobby. Breakfast is good, including typical British baked beans.
reviews.title: Nice place, really good situation

reviews.text: The higher the room, the better views you will enjoy (I believe they have 27 floors...)
reviews.title: Below Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A barely average hotel but a good West London location.
reviews.title: Small room but excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights 29-30th November 2012 in a double room on 7th floor.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was barely motorway hotel standard and not what I expected for a prime location hotel. Everything about the room including the décor, furniture, bathroom and towels was poor compared to other local hotels.
reviews.title: Good Location, Poor Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights and was not disappointed. Hotel is perfectly located for walking to V&A Museum and Harrods. Tube station right beside the hotel and central line to Heathrow Airport so no problem carrying luggage. Room and bathroom both clean and perfectly adequate. TV didn't work, but who needs TV in London. I expect it would have been fixed if we had got around to reporting it.. Very pleasant reception staff
reviews.title: Superb Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's the deal. . . If you're looking for a no-frills hotel that is all about location and price, this is your place. My wife and I booked through Priceline on our recent trip to London. The price was exceptional for the Kensington area, and as many reviewers have mentioned, it is a two or three minute walk to the Gloucester tube station. Gloucester station is excellent as it has entry to three different tube lines. The area is safe, and there are markets and restaurants nearby (La Liasion is a great quick breakfast place). Hotel rooms at the Kensington Forum are small by US standards, and frugal with the ambience, but everything in the room worked and we had a great view. The bathroom was small, and water pressure was weak, but it was doable. All-in-all this hotel was a great choice for the price and location. Since we spent little time in the room to begin with, it really didn't impact our time in London at all. However, if you must stay in a luxury hotel, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Well Worth It!

likes.disliked: — A bigger room and better water pressure would be a nice bonus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Kensington Forum has a fantastic location for a city break in London. We stayed there for 2 nights, and got a fantastic deal through the hotel's website. We arrived at the hotel 2 hours before check in, and were delighted when we were offered a free upgrade to a kingsize room, although this was a smoking room, there wasn't too bad a smell, and we just opened the windows. We could also check in early which was great! The room was a decent size for a London hotel room. Tea/coffee facilities, hairdryer, decent television channels. The best thing was the location. Right next to Glouchester Rd tube station, which was very safe to travel, even late at night. The area of the hotel was lovely. Walk down Cromwell Rd to visit some lovely restaurants. I would highly recommend Little India. Yummy!!! Have had some problems with the hotel over payment after returning home, but im sure this doesnt happen often. Overall, a great hotel!
reviews.title: Great location!

likes.liked: — the hotel pub - unique for a hotel! Like a real tavern! Forgot we were in the hotel.

reviews.title: good hotel
reviews.text: I booked this hotel via Holiday inn ,2 nights for the price off 1 .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean average UK size .The rooms have air con and the windows do open .The windows have two layers off double glazing making them soundproof. A lot of hotels in the area are converted houses this hotel is purpose built .
reviews.title: Good price / location, but no thrills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this room via Lastminute's Secret hotels and is described as an awesome Kensington hotel. In fact, the description is correct in that the Hotel is awesome in size - 20+ plus floors but is quite a dated modern concrete structure.
reviews.title: Not quite awesome Kensington Holiday Inn Forum

reviews.text: On arrival minor blip, in that the receptionist mentioned that I was booked in for 1 night only, in fact it was 2, but this was rectified professionally.
reviews.title: Would not stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first room was adequate, simple and clean. However, the aged fitments and holes in the wall where the trouser press once had been did not impress, the hotel provided an alternative room with no fuss.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean,comfortable and quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good value

reviews.text: The hotel is ideal for the business traveller not for a romanic getaway.
reviews.title: Suited us fine

likes.disliked: — The tight squeeze when the pullout bed was open

reviews.text: I really love the location of this hotel. Kensington is a charming place. And the Hyde Park is perfect for jogging after my business activities.
reviews.title: Good location but need upgrade

reviews.text: The hotel is quiet old. The rooms are quite small but the problem is they really could use some renovation. Especially they need better soundproofing of the room. I could hear some noise from outside. Other than that, everything is just average (breakfast, gym, lobby etc).
reviews.title: Good hotel, great area

likes.disliked: — Size of room, small even by European standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I guess it will depend on what you're looking for. For tourist, probably there are cheaper places around unless you have a good deal with the hotel. To be honest, it's quite expensive rate for the facilities they have. But again, the location could justify charging that price.
reviews.title: Exceptionally poor - and surprising - service

reviews.text: Eight of stayed here in June of 2008 and paid less than $150 a night which is a STEAL in London in a hotel of this caliber.....thanks, Priceline!!!
reviews.title: Bad Staff + Bad Services = Bad Hotel !!

likes.liked: — If you stay in a hight floor room you'll get a good veiw

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very nice and the location is excellent. It is a leisurely 10 minute stroll to the tube station and then the greatest city on earth is yours!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I got a good deal on this stay - 2 nights for 123 pounds room only, through the priority club (intercontinental hotel group loyalty scheme), as I was coming to stay to go to a concert/celebrate my daughters 16th Birthday.
reviews.title: Small rooms but mine was clean and a lovelycomfy bed

likes.liked: — The lifts to more than 20 floors is really fast.

reviews.text: Firstly directions to the hotel. The hotel reception/entrance is not on Cromwell Road, but on Courtfield Gardens (I think) behind Cromwell Road, so turn RIGHT out of the Gloucester Rd Station and then turn RIGHT again to walk down the road with Baileys hotel/millenium Gloucester on your Left hand and you will find it on your RHS, next to some plush apartments.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Ther room, reception and the staff

reviews.text: Reception, not too busy when I checked in, my room was ready. I had requested a twin on a high floor away from lifts, and was given room 1007, which met these requirements. Reception staff appeared efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: Got locked out of my room
alex
reviews.text: The room was small, but there was a window that opened and good views over london (although the windows could do with a good scrub!). The room was clean, and looked fine. There was a problem with our toilet when we arrived in that it was blocked. I tried to get someone on the phone (no answer), but whilst I was ringing the handyman came and sorted it all out. The cleaner had already rung for him to sort it out. We had no problems all weekend, but a traveller across the corridor said his tub was taking time to empty. The bath is a 3/4 size one - dinky! Shower pressure was good. Air con wasn't really working for me, it wanted to heat the room, when I wanted it cooling, hence I loved the open window.

reviews.title: Lovely position
reviews.text: The furniture was fine - all light wood, one slight chip to the surface, but we literally used the room to sleep in. There is an empty fridge in the room, ours wasn't working properly, so check if yours is before going down to Waitrose/Tesco for chilled items (I didn't!). Tea/Coffe/hot chocolate are provided in your room. Decoration was to a good standard, and didn't appear to be that old.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights, Friday and Saturday. The hotel is a very short walk away from Gloucester Road Tube station. Greeted by the hotel staff and was upgraded to an executive room. Room was fantastic, very clean and the bed was HUGE. Tea and coffee making facilities and we even had a kitkat each on the side! The concierge recommended to us a few restaurants close by and we were not disappointed. Couldn't find fault in the stay. All in all - fabulous.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights, Wed & Thurs. The hotel was in a great location. it was about 2 minutes walk from Gloucester Rd tube, 10 minutes walk from natural history & V&A museums, 20 minute walk from Harrods, Harvey Nichols etc. The hotel was extremely clean, staff friendly & helpful, breakfast was excellent. Room very comfortable. All in all excellent!
reviews.title: Excellent
Great service and good for families
reviews.text: The location is perfect, we walked all the way to Regents Street with a big pram and visited the National History Museum, Harrods, Winter Wonderland and Hamleys on Regent Street. The phone didn't work in the room.
The staff went out of their way to get our orders taken. We didn't get charged for the warm milk or room service. The room are clean ( a lot better than other 5 star brands we have stayed with).
reviews.title: Cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to get to by car and parking is secure underground.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location...for us.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights on business.
reviews.title: A good value London option

likes.disliked: — Some noise (although this is to be expected with its central location!)

reviews.text: Pros - very clean, excellent breakfast, very conveniently located only a minute or two from Gloucester Rd underground station (excellent links to Central London, Kensington etc.), streets around hotel seemed very safe, and there's a good selection of shops and restaurants in the immediate area, an excellent breakfast (plenty of choice, and is cooked for you rather than self-service from a breakfast buffet but is served quickly).
reviews.title: Nice and cheap for London

likes.disliked: — big and homely, front desk service is a bit slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons - noise from the trains and traffic, although this was far less noticable between midnight and 6am.
reviews.title: Exceed expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and to my surprise (shock), it cost only $100 per night. I've never paid so little for a London hotel. The location is South West London and a healthy but doable walk from landmarks like the Museum of Natural History, Albert's Hall, Kensington Gardens, and Harrods. Hotel is very large and modern but the rooms are decent size, clean, though decor has a hint of tiredness. For the price, nothing was included though you can prepay your buffet breakfasts for 12 pounds. Note that all around the hotel are decent little cafes and shops to get either full breakfasts or breakfast foods.
reviews.title: Good hotel but noisy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the most intimate or quaint place but for the price, who cares? The Picadilly line takes you directly from Heathrow to Gloucester Road station which is about 50 yards from the Hotel.
reviews.title: No problems here
Fabulous
reviews.text: I stayed in the holiday inn as I visited London for the first time and didnt want to end up in a dingy hotel and I wasn't disappointed. From the minute I stepped through the door I knew I was onto a winner. The staff were very polite and did everything necessary to make your stay a great one. The room was a standard double and was furnished with everything you could need and was most importantly clean. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of pillows which makes a nice change. The bar prices where normal for London and the breakfast was Devine.

Entrance to the hotel nice and impressive and very festive. The rooms, however were very small for the amount they charge. The toilet was blocked, I called reception twice no one came! Certain channels were missing on the TV, ie BBC News, was told they were broken! The plastic cups in the bathroom were dirty. The breakfast was dreadful, crossiant was terribly dry as was the bread. Coffee extremely strong. Would never pay £155 for a double room here again.
reviews.title: Double room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situation in a good location, not far from the tube station. Hotel has wonderful views over London. Staff very friendly and very efficient. Breakfast good choice. Stayed here before going to Stamford Bridge, which is a good location. Have stayed here a number of times and enjoy returning each year. We got upgraded to an executive room as we are platinum priority club members which always helps.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel and were very happy with the service & cleanliness. It is located about one block from the Gloucester Road Tube Station on the Piccadilly line ~ perfect for travel to and from Heathrow as well as all the major sights in London (just note that the Tube closes at about 12AM every evening). We only had breakfast once in the hotel ~ it was very plentiful (eggs, assorted meats, cheeses, yogurts, pastries) but there were other places near the Tube that offered a more inexpensive breakfast. The staff was very friendly and our room was small but clean ~ although the bed and pillows were very hard. Our hotel package (booked through Priceline) included free internet ~ which we had to remind the staff about during check out (otherwise it would have cost another 70 GBP!) The hotel guests were professionals ~ many of them were flight attendants and pilots. The gym was large and somewhat modern with treadmills, rowing machines, ellipticals and free weights. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Clean & Convenient!
Small Room, Great Location!
reviews.text: If you're traveling on a budget, not really going to be in your room too much and just want to see London then this is a great place to stay. If you're looking for luxury, keep looking because this is no frills but meets basic needs. It's clean, comfortable but rooms are small and the bathroom even smaller. Only fits one person at a time so keep in mind if you're traveling with friends. The shampoo, soap etc. is pitiful. Bring your own or hit the grocery store. Not a lot of room for luggage, either. Coffee/tea station, small fridge, flat screen TV. 24 hr Tesco grocery store, Starbucks, pharmacy and a Waitrose grocery store all within a block. Olive's restaurant around the corner has an amazing Happy Hour. Also Wildwood Cafe has really good pizza (large servings) for less than 10 pounds. The pub in the hotel has good food and reasonable prices. Found out this is where the major US Airline carriers put their crews up in.
I booked this hotel through a discount website and got a great rate. For the rate I paid, this hotel is excellent. However, if I had paid the standard rate, I wouldn't have been as impressed.
reviews.title: It was just fine

likes.disliked: — Dirty windows and indifferent front desk staff

reviews.text: The Pros:
reviews.title: Great location, pub in the ground floor

likes.liked: — Location, breakfast, pub, cleanliness, free WiFi in lobby
likes.disliked: — a bit farther out from London's city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location. And I mean excellent. It's just a few minutes walk to the Gloucester Rd. tube station. The Natural History Museum, the Science Museum and the Victoria and Albert Museum are all just a 10-15 minute walk away. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, grocery stores, internet cafes, etc.
reviews.title: Double bed? Third times a charm....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A hotel with a lot to offer the guests. There is a breakfast restaurant, a pub on the main floor, a Starbucks with a small restaurant attached, a business center, a fitness center, and a small gift shop in the lobby.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel for weekend break

reviews.text: Typical Holiday Inn rooms. You know what to expect, and for the most part, the rooms live up to those expectations. They're on the small side, but not oppressively so if there's just 1 or 2 of you.
reviews.title: great location, great breakfast!
Perfect for First Visit to London
reviews.text: My husband and I spent six nights at the Holiday Inn Kensington Forum over the 2007 New Year's Holiday. We booked through a package deal with British Airways, and we could not have been more pleased with the hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb with the tube and bus stops literally steps away. The area surrounding the hotel had plenty of restaurants, cafes, and grocery stores to meet every need. With it being our first time to London, we were overwhelmed with the large choice of hotels (and the prices.) If we were to return, we would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice location by Glouchester tube stop

reviews.text: For it being a no-frills Holiday Inn, we were especially impressed with the concierge. Gladstone was a gem in setting up our dinner reservations and various outings. I cannot say enough about how helpful he was.
reviews.title: Great Location and great business hotel

likes.disliked: — Business center close at 7pm, expansive phone charge 4 pound per minute

reviews.text: By European standards, our room was large. The bed was quite comfortable, and we had a lovely view of the city. I was somewhat apprehensive about going all the way to London only to stay in a Holiday Inn, but really, this place was perfect and I would return again in a hearteat.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part about the hotel is the great location in Kensington. It is close to the Tube stop from which you can get anywhere.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — proximity to tube station, cleanliness, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a great rate through Priceline, $90, during pre Xmas weekend in London. The hotel is in Kensington which is not as central as I'd like to be, but it's a 3 minute walk to the Gloucester Road tube station. There are plenty of restaurants in the area as well, including fast food joints and two small-ish supermarkets.
reviews.title: Good location, clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is huge and our room was on the large side for London. Good air conditioning (which I use even in winter), clean, nice sized bathroom, etc. Did not use any of the hotels other services, but I was pleased overall and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location, but not sure it's worth the money

reviews.text: Stayed here because it was free with a British Airways booking. It's in a great location. Love this area because it's within walking distance to museums, Hyde Park, and High St. Kensington where you'll find a great selection of restaurants. It was a good quality room although the bed was and pillows were very firm. The fridge isn't really a fridge. It's an old one from which you could purchase drinks and snacks, so it doesn't keep anything very cold. We couldn't change the thermostat to cooling. It was set on heating and our room had the afternoon sun blaring in making it uncomfortably warm. Had to notify housekeeping to switch it to cooling, but 2 things- they never answered the phone and it would stay on cooling for a while but would revert back to heating. Very odd and annoying as housekeeping never answered their phone (I don't know how you are supposed to get those pillows from the pillow menu.). Switched to a Holiday Inn Express and could change the thermostat there, so I don't get it. The hotel pub has a late liquor license, albeit there can be rowdy tourists in there getting drunk for the first time in years.
reviews.title: Very good overall

reviews.text: It's a decent hotel, although I wouldn't spend a great deal of money on a room here. The Holiday Inn Express in Earl's Ct cost $43 via hotwire.com and was actually more comfortable. It's not as fancy, but it's really good value. What you are really paying for at this hotel is location and in hotel restaurants.
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If the rooms were just a little bigger it would be perfect. We had a fold out bed for our daughter and the first room they gave us we could not get to the bathroom with the sofa folded out. They changed our room for the rest of our stay but the room was not as nice and had a smaller folding bed (so we could walk around it). That was a bit disappointing, but not unusual. We had difficulties finding family rooms often during our trip. Otherwise the hotel was very nice. Concierge was more than helpful. Fantastic location very close to the tube and buses. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Pub in the hotel which served meals.
reviews.title: Change your category from 4 stars to 3 stars

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this location in the past one year. I will not recommend this hotel for a the business traveller who has a tight schedule.
reviews.title: Do not recommend

likes.liked: — proximity to where I wanted to go for business meetings

reviews.text: It takes about 20 minutes to check in and at any time of the day, it takes about 5-10mins to get the elevator to go to your room. The room I was in was ok, but the shower was terrible. Water only trickles out of the shower....the worst I have ever encountered. If you hang around in the lobby, you can hear other people complaining about poor service, poor room quality and a host of other problems to the staff. The staff typically does nothing.
reviews.title: Good stay at Kensington Forum

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, convenient location, teamaking facilities

reviews.text: Receptionist phones are never answered. I had to try four times to get to the front desk on the phone. The operator does not speak proper english...so it is difficult to make them understand what you are talking.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel

reviews.text: There are a lot of small issues like these. Breakfast was included with my room...the food was good. The rooms are not well shielded from noise and I had folks yapping away in the corridoor practically all night. TV is placed in the room such that, if you try watching for a while, it is guaranteed that you will get stiff neck.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: In short, like my past experience, this place is not worth the money you pay for. If you are staying for a day or so it is ok...but be prepared for some poor service quality.
reviews.title: Great location for vacationer

reviews.text: Good news and bad. This hotel's location is excellent, one block from the Tube station and surrounded by pubs, restaurants, 15 minute walk to Harrod's (scary). The hotel's name is 'Holiday Inn', not 'Ritz'. Everything in London is expensive, this may be one of the better of bad bargains. Booking early may yield a manageable room price. The rooms are adequate but small: the beds are clean, shower is hot, tele worked fine. The staff was very pleasant; there is a bar/restaurant/pub; also a workout facility where the machines actually work. Book it for what it is, you will be happy. If expecting Buckingham, you will be disappointed. This was our second stay here, we would return.
reviews.title: On balance

reviews.text: This hotel is located 2 minutes work from Gloucester Road tube station, it’s has about 1000 rooms over 27 floors. The location is great for eating out as within 5 minutes walk there is a massive choice from supermarkets/fast foods to fine dining and everything in-between.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Having stayed at this hotel for over a month, I find it good, the room I am allocated is always on the 27th floor (must be because I am in the loyalty program) as it usually has complementary newspapers, apples and bottled water on the floor. The view of London especially if you are on the east side is amazing! The hotel pub/bar that backs onto the Cromwell road is also very good.
reviews.title: Hotel was average, the location excellent
A nice hotel but chilly
reviews.text: There are problems, the staff at reception can be quite frosty, the water pressure is ok but not fantastic, the hotel internet is expensive, but it’s the same all over the UK, it’s like the hotel telephones, don’t use it buy a dongle!

Booked hotel through a third party (priceline). Choose this hotel because of the advertised free wi-fi instead of choosing a free breakfast. Upon check in discovered NO free wi-fi is offered. I guess my complaint should be with priceline. Tried to negotiate a free breakfast (since that is what I gave up for wi-fi) however, received only two days out of 7 with breakfast. Breakfast was good but not worth the $20.00 charge when not included. Location was EXCELLENT! One block from tube station and large grocery store! Two exceptional restaurants nearby and even more order out or fast food type restaurants! Room was small but safisfactory, great view from 16th floor, clean and the housekeeping services were very good. Would stay there again - for a good deal - the location was THAT good.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers Is Alive And Well

reviews.text: This isn't as charming as the other Holiday Inn (soon to be a Crowne Plaza) on Cromwell Street. It's a large hotel and seems more geared towards visitors in London on business. We stayed for one night as the other Holiday Inn was full. I was pleased that we were able to get a room on such short notice. The room was fine. The decorating was a bit out-dated, but the view was good and the beds were comfortable. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a restaurant and a pub on the property. It is very close to the tube -- just walk out the front entrance, take a right and then another right on Gloucester road. It's a two minute walk at most.
reviews.title: Nice room, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We generally use Priceline whenever we can because we always get a great deal. We got this for $75 a night, which is a lot cheaper than any listed price we could find. This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel. Using Priceline, we usually get this one or the Copthorne Tara, but I prefer the Forum. It is a great location, the rooms are a bit basic, but clean and we actually got a pretty good view this time. Let's face it, just because the hotel is 4 star does NOT mean your room will be, but this really isn't too bad. The rooms have a kettle with tea and coffee (I love that most hotels in Britain do this), but we had to call down to get an iron and an ironing board. The room also had a fridge which is great to store orange juice and anything else you might need, but the fridge really could have used a good scrubbing! I noticed that another reviewer said the same thing. Overall, I like this hotel. The rooms are a bit more updated than those at the Copthorne, but I think that both hotels are more comparable to a 3 star rating. Oh, and it is helpful to remember that you are in London so, yes, the rooms are going to be a bit smaller than those you have stayed in before.
reviews.title: Got a great deal on Priceline!

reviews.text: When travelling with teenagers, conveniance is the key. Holiday Inn Kensington Forum is located 3 minutes from the tube station South Kensington. It is a large business hotel, with good weekend deals. We were given a fairly spacious room on the 17th floor, with a fantastic view of London. Large, well lit bathroom and the latest films on pay-tv.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.text: We arrived at 11 am, but were able to check in with the professional and service-minded staff right away. The concierge was also very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: excellent location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was expensive, but there are numerous coffee shops nearby. A short bus trip to Victoria & Albert Museum, as well as the Museum of Natural History. A very short tube ride to Harrod's og Kensington High Street.
reviews.title: What a disappointment

reviews.text: i have been there in february 2009 for five nights.i was alone. the staff made me feel like home. i stayed again for three nights in june 2009 with my mother. once more,everybody did his best to help us. both times they gave me non-smoking confortable rooms with a great view. i have stayed in much more expensive hotels in london but they were terrible. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in Kensington forum for 3 nights in January. Price was unbeatable, just 79 pounds/night. We wanted something more spacious, but this hotel had extremely convenient location and good reviews, so we decided to stay there.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Room wasn't that big but looks like brand new, bed was very comfy (I love holiday inn's pillow menu^_^). Bathroom also was very clean with no smell of chemistry.
reviews.title: OK hotel in Central London

reviews.text: The only problem we had with fridge. It didn't work. We call reception and in 10-15 minuts problem was solved!
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 thing I was disappointed - they took incredible deposit, about 300 pounds (we made payment for room 100% in advance). next time i would say that I have only cash.
reviews.title: Tiny room, malfunctioning heater

reviews.text: went for a city break with the family hotel good location harrods 20 mins walk,royal albert hall 10 mins,and under ground around the corner,plenty to see and do around hotel.staff at hotel friendly rooms a good size will be going back in august breakfast good.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: i nearly never went after some peoples reviews but it pays to find out for yourself
reviews.title: Better than I expected for such a large and busy hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have a good stay.
reviews.title: Great location, bad hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in England on a group tour, so we didn't choose where to stay. I had read some negative reviews on this hotel before we left. So I am pleased to say I found the hotel to be just fine.
reviews.title: dated rooms

reviews.text: I will say they seem to be inflexible about their 2 pm check-in time. Our group arrived at 10 am. First we were told the rooms might be ready at noon, and then 2 pm. Ours was ready at 2:45. I think this is because they start cleaning rooms at the top of the 26-stories. I went to a higher floor for ice and saw them up there cleaning early. You will see a lot of airline flight crews come and go, and I noticed they don't seem to check in, and the ones I shared an elevator with were near the top, so I assume that is why the upper story rooms are cleaned first.
reviews.title: Just about OK

aka: Holiday Inn London Kensington Forum Hotel
description: The perfect option for business or leisure the Holiday Inn London Kensington Forum sets the standard for hotels in Kensington. Stroll to Gloucester Road Tube Station, your gateway to the sights of the city. Enjoy the hotel s close proximity to Harrod's, the Royal Albert Hall, Earls Court and Olympia Exhibition Centres, the Natural History, Science and V&A Museums and Kensington Palace. As the tallest Holiday Inn Hotel in Europe, our 27-floor and 906 bedroom hotel offers modern bedrooms with stunning views of London from our higher floors. The hotel also offers a choice of suites and accessible rooms (one with hoist). All rooms are equipped with high speed Internet and Wi-Fi connectivity is available in the public areas. The hotel's carpark has 76 spaces and there is a 24-hour fitness room. Holiday Inn Kensington Forum offers its guests a choice of three restaurant and bars whether you want to relax with dinner, grab a quick snack or enjoy a pint of traditional British beer. The Academy offers 13 meeting and event rooms for up to 300 people, all with natural daylight, high-speed Internet and unlimited Starbucks tea and coffee.
